content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────
### Extraction System at Position(-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– A burner inserter located at Position(-3.5, 27.5) with its drop position at Position(-3.5, 28.5)

### Copper Cable Factory at Position(2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– A cable factory input chest at Position(2.5, 17.5)
– A factory burner inserter placed at Position(3.5, 17.5) that interfaces with:
 • An additional burner inserter at Position(2.5, 16.5)
 • An assembling machine at Position(1.5, 19.5)

### Depot Belt System at Position(3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– A wooden chest serving as the belt depot at Position(3.5, 15.5)
– A dedicated transport belt segment placed adjacent at Position(4.5, 15.5)
– A depot burner inserter placed at Position(3.5, 14.5) (using direction UP, with its pickup position at Position(3.5, 15.5))


ERROR TIPS
──────────
– Errors connecting transport belts:
 • When attempting to connect transport belts, the target was misinterpreted as a Prototype.SteamEngine. Always ensure that the target is a valid inserter by adding an appropriate intermediary inserter that feeds items into the target.
– Errors when placing a wooden chest:
 • If the target position is too far (as in the distance between (0, 0) and (3.5, 15.5)), move closer before placing.
 • Verify that the required wooden chest is available in the inventory prior to placement.
 • Use correctly defined variable names (for example, avoid undefined identifiers like “target_chest”) when referencing the placement target.
